intro: Pentaphyllum rectum, commonly known as the straight pentaphyllum, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands or streambanks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a smooth, lance-shaped appearance. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that releases tiny seeds when mature.
